param.name: GRanges
param.label: Sequence Names
param.help: Enter the sequence names followed by a comma e.g. chrA, chrA, chrB

param.name: IRanges
param.label: Ranges
param.help: Upload as a dataframe where the first column is the start position and the second column is the end position.

param.name: pe
param.label: Is paired-end data present in the BAM file(s)?
param.help: Reads are assumed to be single-end when None is selected

param.name: max_frag
param.label: Maximum fragment length corresponding to a read pair

param.name: dedup
param.label: Ignore marked duplicate reads?
param.help: Marked duplicate reads will be removed with if yes is selected. This may be necessary when many rounds of PCR have been performed. However, it is not recommended for routine counting as it will interfere with the downstream statistical methods. Note that the duplicate field must be set beforehand in the BAM file for this argument to have any effect

param.name: minq
param.label: Minimum mapping quality score for an aligned read
param.help: Reads will be filtered by their mapping quality scores. This is generally recommended to remove low-confidence alignments. The exact threshold for minq will depend on the range of scores provided by the aligner. No filtering on the score will be performed if no value specified.

param.name: forward
param.label: How should the reads be extracted?

param.name: restrict
param.label: Names of allowable chromosomes from which readswill be extracted
param.help: Reads will only be extracted for the specified chromosomes. This is useful to restrict the analysis to interesting chromosomes, e.g., no contigs/scaffolds or mitochondria.

param.name: discard
param.label: Discard any alignments?
param.help: A read will be removed if the corresponding alignment is wholly contained within the supplied ranges. This is useful for removing reads in repeat regions.

param.name: pval_col
param.label: Specify the column of tab with the p-values
param.help: Enter a string or integer

param.name: fc_col
param.label: Specify the column of tab with the log-fold changes
param.help: Enter a string or integer

param.name: mergeWindows_selector
param.label: Additional parameters to pass to mergeWindows?

param.name: sign_selector
param.label: Specify a positive log-FC for each window?

param.name: sign
param.label: Positive log-FC for each window
param.help: Upload as datafame with a column of logical values

param.name: max_width
param.label: Maximum size of merged intervals
param.help: Specification prevents the formation of excessively large clusters when many adjacent regions are present. Any cluster that is wider than the max width is split into multiple subclusters of (roughly) equal size. Specifically, the cluster interval is partitioned into the smallest number of equally-sized subintervals where each subinterval is smaller than max width. Windows are then assigned to each subinterval based on the location of the window midpoints. Suggested values range from 2000 to 10000 bp, but no limits are placed on the maximum size if no value entered.

param.name: ignore_strand
param.label: Ignore the strandedness of regions?
param.help: If no is selected, the entries in regions are split into their separate strands.

param.name: query
param.label: Ranges
param.help: Upload as a dataframe where the first column is the start position and the second column is the end position.

param.name: subject
param.label: Ranges
param.help: Upload as a dataframe where the first column is the start position and the second column is the end position.

param.name: maxgap
param.label: Maximum Gap
param.help: A single integer >= -1. If type is set to any, maxgap is interpreted as the maximum gap that is allowed between 2 ranges for the ranges to be considered as overlapping. The gap between 2 ranges is the number of positions that separate them. The gap between 2 adjacent ranges is 0. By convention when one range has its start or end strictly inside the other (i.e. non-disjoint ranges), the gap is considered to be -1. If type is set to anything else, maxgap has a special meaning that depends on the particular type.

param.name: minoverlap
param.label: Minimum Overlap
param.help: A single non-negative integer. Only ranges with a minimum of minoverlap overlapping positions are considered to be overlapping. When type is any, at least one of maxgap and minoverlap must be set to its default value.

param.name: type
param.label: Types of overlap
param.help: If type is start or end, the intervals are required to have matching starts or ends, respectively. Specifying equal as the type returns the intersection of the start and end matches. If type is within, the query interval must be wholly contained within the subject interval. Note that all matches must additionally satisfy the minoverlap constraint described above.

param.name: select
param.label: Select
param.help: When select is all, the results are returned as a HitsList object. Otherwise the returned value depends on the drop argument. When select not all or drop, an IntegerList is returned, where each element of the result corresponds to a space in query. When select is drop, an integer vector is returned containing indices that are offset to align with the unlisted query.

repeat.name: bam_input
repeat.title: Upload indexed BAM files in sorted order

param.name: spacing
param.label: Distance between consecutive windows
param.help: New windows are defined by sliding the current window to the right by the specified spacing.

param.name: width
param.label: Width of the window
param.help: The value of width can be interpreted as the width of the contact area between the DNA and protein. In practical terms, it determines the spatial resolution of the analysis. Larger windows count reads over a larger region which results in larger counts. This results in greater detection power at the cost of resolution.

param.name: ext_select
param.label: Average length(s) of the sequenced fragments in each library

param.name: ext
param.label: Enter an integer as the average length

param.name: ext_list1
param.label: Enter an integer or list
param.help: When multiple fragment lengths are specified, enter a list of integers followed by a comma. e.g. 100, 150, 200, 250

param.name: ext_list2
param.label: Enter an integer or list
param.help: When multiple fragment lengths are specified, enter a list of integers followed by a comma. e.g. 100, 150, 200, 250

param.name: shift
param.label: Specifying how much the start of each window should be shifted to the left
param.help: The first window on a chromosome starts at base position 1. Specifying an appropriate value to shift to the left.

param.name: filter
param.label: Minimum count sum across libraries for each window

param.name: bin
param.label: Perform binning?
param.help: If yes is selected, settings are internally adjusted so that all reads are counted into non-overlapping adjacent bins of size width.

repeat.name: bam_input
repeat.title: Upload indexed BAM files in sorted order

param.name: ext_select
param.label: Average length(s) of the sequenced fragments in each library

param.name: ext
param.label: Enter an integer as the average length

param.name: o_weight
param.label: Specify weights for each overlapped window
param.help: Upload a dataframe with a column of weights. This parameter refers to the weights for each region-window relationship. This allows for different weights to be assigned to the same window in different regions.

param.name: i_weight
param.label: Specify weights for each individual window
param.help: Upload a dataframe with a column of weights. This parameter is the weight of the window itself, and is the same regardless of the region.
